Method:
1. Gather All Ingredients and tools 2. Set up robot coupe slicer for 1/8" slicing. If you don't know how to set it up, ask Chef or a 1st Cook. 3. Chop the ends off of jalapenos and place in compost bin. Do not remove seeds. Set up 4" full hotel pan under the chute to catch the sliced jalapenos. 4. On the slowest speed, carfully drop peppers into the feed chute. Do not mash a whole bunch in there, or else the cuts won't come out even. 5. Repeat until production is done for the day. Label, date, refrigerate, or hold cold for service.
-cool, store, label and rotated this item with older product correctly and diligently

1) Remove all leaves from thick stem.
2) Stack and line stem to tip, up 10-20 leaves largest at the bottom, smallest on top. Roll the stack in to a tight a tube as possible. Starting at the tip of the tube, holding stem, cut super thin ribbons of leaf.
3) Final product should be thin strips that can be used for garnish. Cut only what you need for the day, as they do not last very long.

PREP RECIPE
Mass to volume conversion recipe

PREP RECIPE
There are approx. 4 lemons per pound. a lemon is cut into 8 wedges, this recipe represents this.

1) In Robot Coupe slice onion and zucchini.
2) In Robot Coupe shred carrots.
3) Drain roasted peppers and slice.
4) In rondo over medium heat add olive oil and seasoning. Add onion, garlic and carrot and sweat until softened and fragrant.
5) Add zucchini and peppers and cook until just warmed through (3-4 minutes).
6) Check for seasoning.

Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method: 1.Dip small batches (2-3orders at a time) of cauliflour in batter, letting excess drip off 2. Fry in 350 degree oil until floaring/ golden brown, being sure not to let batter clump together when they get placed in the oil 3. skim the oil with each batch to remove scraps of batter 4. Rest cooked florets on a resting rack to let the steam out. While they're hot season with s&p 5. keep warm in a warmer open so that the batter doesnt get soggy/soft
